projects.title: Cloud9 Solution Store
projects.category: Tech data integration for Cloud9 clients.
projects.more: This website uses NodeJs, MongoDB, React/Redux. Authentication is done using Microsoft Oauth and the base functionality is the integration of Tech Data Canada's API. The website will be the front facing online store for clients that have had their email addresses authorized. Tech Data XML API, PayPal Checkout API, IT Glue REST API, and a NodeJS backend API is what this website uses to function.

projects.title: Youtube Channel Automation
projects.category: Automation of a Youtube channel using Reddit's API
projects.more: Using Python, the goal of this project is to automate a Youtube channel. The program uses the Reddit API and MoviePy library to download, concatenate, and render videos which can than be uploaded to YouTube using their API. The videos can be gathered from specific subreddits using filters and it can also pull videos from TikTok but it is less efficient. The last functionality currently is that it can pull subreddit submissions from a specified subreddit, put the text in a video and narrate it using Google's text to speech library.

projects.title: AlgoSats App
projects.more: The app uses React Native and Expo. It currently receives push notifications from the same backend as my AlgoSats website.

projects.title: AlgoSats - Personal Project
projects.more: This website uses NodeJS, MongoDB, and React. It has a basic chart that receives instant updates from Binance's websockets and my own backend websocket server. It also scans about 50-100 cryptocurrency USDT pairs, takes screenshots of charts originating in browser and sends signals to telegram and my mobile app based on a strategy I've developed. The plan is to make the chart better and implement analytical tools into the website.

projects.title: CryptoTrade University Project
projects.category: A demo crypto trading competition platform
projects.more: This was a last semester University project. Technologies used are MySQL, PHP, Vanilla JS, jQuery and ajax. This website allows an admin to create trading competitions and manage them. Users who sign up for competitions then get an initial amount of demo money to trade within the given amount of time of the competition. The leaderboard shows current rankings as well as completed and upcoming competitions. Look below for the admin account credentials.

projects.title: Google Scripts Crypto Scanner
projects.category: A program that periodically checks price history of dynamically selected cryptocurrencies.
projects.more: This application runs on Google scripts and uses Binance's API as a data source. After receiving the data it scans history price points for patterns and sends signals to Twitter and Telegram.
